greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest unhappy number that takes n steps to reach any of the unhappy cycle (4, 16, 37, 58, 89, 145, 42, 20) under iteration of sum of squares of digits map.
comment: This sequence is an analog of sequence A001273 with the unhappy numbers instead of the happy numbers.
example: 15 is the fourth term because: 15: 1^2 + 5^2 = 26 / 26: 2^2 + 6^2 = 40 / 40: 4^2 + 0^2 = 16 and 16 is a member of the unhappy number series (4, 16, 37, 58, 89, 145, 42, 20)
results.author: _Sergio Pimentel_, Apr 30 2004
ext: The next term, 577999999999....999999999999 (199 digits) is too large to include.
Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 03 2010
